pull.title: rework ClientModel::getBlockSource() + BitcoinGUI::setNumBlocks()
pull.body:
- updates ClientModel::getBlockSource() to return all available states and
  sorts enum BlockSource in order of usage cases (none default, then reindex,
  import and network)
- updates BitcoinGUI::setNumBlocks() to better use getBlockSource() and
  also adds a message, when we have NO block source available

events.message:

This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
ACK. Tested and code changes look fine to me.
I would love to see this in 0.8.2 :).

issue.title: bitcoin-qt 0.8.2rc1 never finishes loading the gui
issue.body:
After the splash screen, it appears the main windows, but thoroughly empty. rpc works fine if started with -server=1, but you can't stop the program. debug.log looks fine, rpc order to stop gets there, but is ignored.

Environment is a minimal debian wheezy i386 vm with fluxbox, and without network.

bitcoin-qt 0.8.1 works fine there, and both versions of bitcoind too.

comments.body: When you have network problems (internet access, proxy) and before a connection could be made to another node. I find it helpful to have that state shown, as it will tell users there is something not working.
